summary: A letter from a Metropolitan Police Deputy Assistant Commissioner to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, providing the contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor in London in response to a request related to the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the letter, leading the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the U.S. investigation (United States v. Jeffrey Epstein) for allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The individual whose solicitor's contact details are being provided to the U.S. investigation.

persons.name: Gerrard Tyrrell
persons.context: Named as the solicitor for Prince Andrew at the law firm Harbottle & Lewis LLP.

connections.description: Gerrard Tyrrell is identified as the solicitor for Prince Andrew.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Metropolitan Police Letter to U.S. Attorney
events.description: A Deputy Assistant Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police writes to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman to provide the contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor.

locations: New Scotland Yard, 1-8 Richmond Terrace, Victoria Embankment, London SW1A 2JL
keyFacts: The U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 Cr. 490) involved seeking contact information for Prince Andrew's legal representation in London.
The Metropolitan Police in London facilitated this request by providing the contact details for solicitor Gerrard Tyrrell of Harbottle & Lewis LLP.
The correspondence indicates official U.S. government interest in Prince Andrew in relation to the Epstein investigation as of December 2019.
